isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 9200 9300 9400 MODELS BUILT AFTER JANUARY 1, 1995 - CATERPILLAR 3176B/3406E ELECTRONIC ENGINE CONTROLS - 1994 - ELECTRICAL OPERATION - ATA DATA LINK CONNECTOR (220)

svcproc.title: ATA DATA LINK CONNECTOR (220)
svcproc.para:
Refer to
CIRCUIT DIAGRAMS, Figure 6.07 or Figure 6.10 and Figure 6.11
, for this discussion.

figure.caption: Figure 6.11 - Speedometer/Tachometer Gauge With Caterpillar 3176B And 3406E

svcproc.para: The six-pin ATA Data Link connector (220) allows Electronic Service Tools (EST) to communicate with the ECM. The data link carries serial data transmissions between the ECM and the electronic service tool and provides vehicle and engine speed information to the speedometer/tachometer unit. The data link provides communication capabilities for:
Data Link connector (220) is located on left instrument panel. Four of the six connector cavities have terminals. Those terminal/circuits are as follows:

step1.para: Terminal A, circuit 98A(+) connects Data Link connector (220) to (514) Datalink Positive bus connector. Circuit 98(+) connects (514) Datalink Positive bus connector to ECM connector (558) terminal 7. Bus connector (514) is also connected by circuit 47/48(+) through connector (595) to the Speedometer/Tachometer unit. Note that bus connector (514) acts like a splice, electrically connecting all circuits into the connector together.

Terminal B, circuit 98C(-) connects Data Link connector (220) to (515) Datalink Negative bus connector. Circuit 98B(-) connects (515) Datalink Negative bus connector to ECM connector (558) terminal 1. Bus connector (515) is also connected by circuit 47/48(-) through connector (595) to the Speedometer/Tachometer unit. Note that bus connector (515) acts like a splice, electrically connecting all circuits into the connector together.
The positive and negative data link circuits are twisted wire pairs. The twisted wires serve to shield the wires from interference - MINIMUM 2 twists per inch.

Terminal C, circuit 97DL supplies ignition voltage (12V) for electronic service tools, when the key is ON. Circuit 97DL receives power from 5A fuse F10-C. Circuit 13U supplies power from Ignition Adapter (607).
Terminal E, circuit 11-GL is grounded through circuit 11-GR at Ground Adapter (454).
